page.title: 01WITNESHAM,SWILLAND VILLAGES
page.content: THE POPULATIONS OF WITNESHAM IN 1983 WAS 820.THE VILLAGE ITSELF STRETCHES FOR OVER A MILE ALONG THE B1077 ABOUT FIVE MILES NORTH OF IPSWICH. AT THE NORTH END OF THE VILLAGE THE HOUSES ARE A MIXTURE OF PRIVATE AND COUNCIL, THE LARGEST ESTATE BEING THE COUNCIL AREA SURROUNDING WEYLAND ROAD. OUR SURVEY INCLUDES A SMALL AREA OF HENLEY VILLAGE WHICH HAD A POPULATION OF 50 IN 1983.INCLUDED IN THIS AREA IS HENLEY VILLAGE SCHOOL .IT CATERS FOR 95 CHILDREN AGED BETWEEN 5 AND 11 YEARS. THE PRESENT HEAD TEACHER IS MR. SMART. THE REST OF THE AREA IS PREDOMINANTLY FARM LAND. THE AVERAGE FAMILY IN THE AREA HAS 2 TELEVISIONS,2 CARS AND 4 RADIOS.1 IN 3 FAMILIES HAVE A VIDEO,1 IN 2 A COMPUTER.BOTH VILLAGE SCHOOLS HAVE A COMPUTER.
